page.title: 14THE NATIONAL TRUST
page.content: THE LARGEST LAND OWNERS IN PATTERDALE AND GLENRIDDING IS THE NATIONAL TRUST. THIS IS A GROUP OF PEOPLE WHO LIKE THE COUNTRYSIDE IN THE LAKE DISTRICT. THE PEOPLE HAVE FORMED AN ORGANISATION, AND AS WELL AS LAND THE TRUST OWNS A LOT OF LAKELAND HOUSES AND FARMS. MOST OF THE LAKE IS OWNED BY THE NATIONAL TRUST. AT OUR SCHOOL WE HAVE DONE SOME CONSERVATION PROJECTS FOR THE NATIONAL TRUST. ONE OF THE PROJECTS WAS PUTTING UP SOME BIRD BOXES AT BLOWICK BAY. ANOTHER PROJECT WAS SPLITTING UP WORDSWORTHS DAFFODILLS AT GLENCOYNE. THIS IS ON THE SHORE OF ULLSWATER WHERE WILLIAM WORDSWORTH WAS WALKING PAST ONE DAY WHEN HE SAW ALL THE DAFFODILS 'FLUTTERING AND DANCING IN THE BREEZE.'
